    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: gargi-sinha\n manager: martinco\r\n ms.service: entra-external-id\r\n ms.topic: concept-article\r\n-ms.date: 05/22/2025\r\n+ms.date: 09/09/2025\r\n ms.author: gasinh\r\n \r\n #customer intent: I need to understand subscriptions and billing, consumer app security, and how to prevent fraud tactics in Microsoft Entra External ID. \r\n@@ -110,7 +110,7 @@ To strengthen defenses, Microsoft Entra External ID has a premium fraud preventi\n \r\n ### International Revenue Share Fraud\r\n \r\n-An International Revenue Share Fraud (IRSF) is a financially driven attack possible when you expose short message service (SMS) verification on a publicly accessible endpoint. When you enable [Microsoft Entra multifactor authentication (MFA)](/entra/identity/authentication/concept-mfa-howitworks) on Microsoft Entra External ID, IRSF attacks are possible. With SMS verification enabled, Microsoft Entra has two built-in protections: \r\n+An International Revenue Share Fraud (IRSF) is a financially driven attack possible when you expose short message service (SMS) verification on a publicly accessible endpoint. When you enable [Microsoft Entra multifactor authentication (MFA) on Microsoft Entra External ID](../external-id/customers/concept-multifactor-authentication-customers.md), IRSF attacks are possible. With SMS verification enabled, Microsoft Entra has two built-in protections: \r\n \r\n * **Telephony throttling** helps mitigate the risk of service outages and performance degradation\r\n * **CAPTCHA for SMS-based MFA** helps defend against automated attacks by distinguishing human users from bots. If a user is deemed high-risk, access is blocked, or a CAPTCHA challenge appears before an SMS verification code is sent. \r\n@@ -120,7 +120,7 @@ As another layer of defense, we recommend you review the following table to cons\n |Security control|Description|\r\n |---|---|\r\n |WAF: Bot protection| To trigger OTP messages during sign-up, enable the frontline of defense against IRSF attacks, typically driven by bots that generate high-volume traffic. |\r\n-|Regions that require MFA telephony verification opt-in |Help prevent telephony-based fraud: Microsoft doesn't automatically enable phone-based MFA verification for some country or region codes. To support sign-in from these regions, an administrator submits a support request to opt in and enable telephony verification for those codes. To allow traffic from deactivated regions, activate them with the [Microsoft Graph API](/graph/use-the-api). |\r\n+|Regions that require MFA telephony verification opt-in |Help prevent telephony-based fraud: Microsoft doesn't automatically enable phone-based MFA verification for some country or region codes. To support sign-in from these regions, an administrator submits a support request to opt in and enable telephony verification for those codes. To allow traffic from deactivated regions, activate them with the Microsoft Graph API. For more information, see [Regional opt-in for MFA telephony verification with external tenants](../external-id/customers/how-to-region-code-opt-in.md). |\r\n |Excessive SMS OTPs from one IP address or ASN. |Implement monitoring and alerting for a high volume of SMS one-time password (OTP) requests originating from the same IP address, ASN, or geographic location. For example, trigger an alert for excessive SMS OTPs from a single IP or geo-coordinates in a short time. This scenario can indicate an IRSF attack. </br> To improve accuracy and reduce noise, refine the alert criteria. Focus on unsuccessful OTP requests by users. In IRSF scenarios, attackers typically don't complete authentication. Then want to generate SMS traffic to phone numbers for financial gain. Use this approach to see potentially malicious activity while minimizing false positives. |\r\n \r\n ## Sign-in protection: Account takeover\r"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -180,7 +180,7 @@ The Conditional Access Optimization Agent integrates with Microsoft Intune to mo\n \n Agent suggestions for Intune scenarios cover specific user groups and platforms (iOS or Android). For example, the agent identifies an active Intune app protection policy that targets the \"Finance\" group, but determines there isn't a sufficient Conditional Access policy that enforces app protection. The agent creates a report-only policy that requires users to access resources only through compliant applications on iOS devices.\n \n-The agent must be running as a Security Administrator or Global Administrator to identify Intune app protection policies. The Conditional Access Administrator role doesn't have sufficient privileges in Intune.\n+To identify Intune app protection policies, the agent must be running as a Global Administrator or Conditional Access Administrator AND Global Reader. Conditional Access Administrator is not sufficient on its own for the agent to product Intune suggestions.\n \n ## Remove agent\n "

Other than User objects that have a Recycle Bin, any other object types deleted with this function **can't be recovered**.\n+\n ### EXAMPLES\n #### EXAMPLE 1\n ```\n@@ -1179,16 +1187,17 @@ This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable\n ### INPUTS\n InputCsvFilename must point to a CSV file with at least 2 columns: SourceAnchor, SyncObjectType\n ### OUTPUTS\n-Shows results from ExportDeletions operation DISCLAIMER: Other than User objects that have a Recycle Bin, any other object types DELETED with this function can't be RECOVERED!\n+Shows results from ExportDeletions operation \n \n ## Remove-ADSyncToolsAadPublicFolders\n ### SYNOPSIS\n Removes synchronized Mail-Enabled Public Folders (MEPF) present in Microsoft Entra ID.\n \n You can specify the SourceAnchor/ImmutableID for the target MEPF object to delete or provide a CSV list with a batch of objects to delete that can be obtained with `Export-ADSyncToolsAadPublicFolders`.\n-This function requires the credentials of a Global Administrator in Microsoft Entra ID and authentication with MFA isn't supported.\n-NOTE: If DirSync is disabled on the tenant, you need to temporary re-enable DirSync in order to remove orphaned Mail Enabled Public Folders from Microsoft Entra ID.\n+**NOTE:**\n \n+This function requires the credentials of a Global Administrator in Microsoft Entra ID and authentication with MFA isn't supported.\n+If DirSync is disabled on the tenant, you need to temporary re-enable DirSync in order to remove orphaned Mail Enabled Public Folders from Microsoft Entra ID.\n ### SYNTAX\n #### CsvInput\n ```\n@@ -1204,8 +1213,6 @@ Deletes from Microsoft Entra ID a synced Mail-Enabled Public Folder object based\n The CSV list can be obtained with `Export-ADSyncToolsAadPublicFolders` to identify and remove all orphaned Mail-Enabled Public Folders in Microsoft Entra ID.\n **IMPORTANT**: This operation is irreversible. Deleted Mail-Enabled Public Folder objects cannot be restored from Microsoft Entra ID.\n \n-This function requires the credentials of a Global Administrator in Microsoft Entra ID and authentication with MFA isn't supported.\n-NOTE: If DirSync has been disabled on the tenant, you'll need to temporarily re-enabled DirSync in order to remove orphaned Mail Enabled Public Folders from Microsoft Entra ID.\n ### EXAMPLES\n #### EXAMPLE 1\n ```"

]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
These commits primarily focus on updating documentation within Microsoft's Entra ID documentation. Key changes include:

*   **Date updates:** A minor update to the publication date of the "Deployment external operations" article.
*   **Role permission clarification:** The documentation for the "Conditional Access Optimization Agent" has been clarified to specify the necessary administrator roles (Global Administrator and Conditional Access Administrator AND Global Reader) for identifying Intune app protection policies.
*   **Tooling documentation enhancements:** The `Remove-ADSyncToolsAadObject` and `Remove-ADSyncToolsAadPublicFolders` cmdlets documentation has been updated with important notes. These include warnings about the irreversibility of deletions for non-user objects, the requirement for Global Administrator credentials (without MFA support), and the temporary re-enabling of DirSync if it's disabled on the tenant.
